snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones' review: Breaker of chains, breakers of will
snippet.description: The HBO show looks at how its characters keep going, even when life seems unendurable.

snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones' recap: The first puzzle piece in a murder mystery
snippet.description: A major character returns, and has a hand in Joffrey's death; across the Narrow Sea, Khaleesi finds another city to conquer

snippet.title: Young Clippers try to mature against Warriors
snippet.description: The Clippers insist they just weren't themselves in losing their series opener. They chalk it up to being too amped, which led to mistakes on both ends.

snippet.title: 'No Way Back,' a Matthew Klein novel combining comedy and shocking violence
snippet.description: The story begins with a long, graphic torture scene, turns to comedy and reaches an unexpected ending.

snippet.title: Boxer Rubin 'Hurricane' Carter dies at 76
snippet.description: Mr. Carter's wrongful murder conviction became an international symbol of racial injustice.

snippet.title: Boxer Rubin 'Hurricane' Carter dies at 76
snippet.description: Rubin "Hurricane" Carter, the boxer whose wrongful murder conviction became an international symbol of racial injustice, has died at 76.

snippet.title: In Md. court, teen takeover offers a second chance
snippet.description: The 16-year-old said he didn't think before stealing a shirt, pants, hat and jewelry box from a local Kohl's. He had fallen in with new friends after moving from Virginia to Maryland, and he followed their lead. He put on the clothes and started to walk out of the store.

snippet.title: Charity Works: The 'art' of receiving philanthropy
snippet.description: This nonprofit learned how not to "chase the money."

snippet.title: A veteran of Afghanistan struggles to transition from military to civilian life
snippet.description: Transitioning from military to civilian life, and from camaraderie to isolation.

snippet.title: Sen. Warren's book focuses on working family woes
snippet.description: At the beginning of her new book, "A Fighting Chance," U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren describes the moment she grew up.
